triples.name: Web Search
triples.relevance: The conference focuses on web search as a core research area and organizes papers addressing search challenges and methodologies.

triples.name: Data Mining
triples.relevance: Data mining is the second major research area the conference covers alongside web search, attracting papers on extraction and pattern discovery techniques.

triples.name: Peer Review
triples.relevance: The conference employs peer review methodology with Program Committee members and Senior PC members to evaluate and select papers.

triples.name: Blinded Experiment
triples.relevance: The conference uses double-blind review procedures where reviewers and authors are anonymized to reduce bias in the evaluation process.

triples.name: Association for Computing Machinery
triples.relevance: WSDM is an ACM-sponsored conference, leveraging ACM's infrastructure and credibility as the premier computing research organization.
